meanings.definition: The eldest son of the king of France, traditionally the heir to the throne.
meanings.sent1: The dauphin was next in line to become the king.
meanings.sent2: The dauphin was expected to inherit the crown.
meanings.sent3: The dauphin tried on the king's crown as a joke.
meanings.sent4: The dauphin's destiny was intertwined with the throne.
meanings.sent5: The dauphin's role was crucial for the kingdom's future.

meanings.definition: A title given to the eldest son of the king of France.
meanings.sent1: The dauphin held a prestigious title in the royal family.
meanings.sent2: The dauphin was addressed with great respect due to his title.
meanings.sent3: The dauphin's title made him feel important and special.
meanings.sent4: The dauphin's title carried significant responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The dauphin's title set him apart from other nobles.

meanings.sent1: The dauphin symbol was often seen in royal emblems.
meanings.sent2: The dauphin emblem represented grace and agility.
meanings.sent3: The dauphin in the coat of arms seemed to be smiling.
meanings.sent4: The dauphin in heraldry leaped across the shield with elegance.
meanings.sent5: The dauphin in the emblem seemed to dance with the waves.
